This is used to get a new access token using the refresh token. This needs to be done before the refresh token expires. If it has already expired, you need to do the authentication step from the stretch.

This is used to get the customer (end-user application) access token using the server access token and customer number created in the GTN trading platform. This access token can be used to access the GTN open API via end-user applications.

This is used to get a new end-user access token using the refresh token. This needs to be done before the refresh token expires. If it has already expired, you need to do the authentication step from the stretch.

This is used to validate a given customer trading password.
Internal API (intended exclusively for internal development purposes)
supports:   customer token
(Required) trading password hash
(Required) trading password hash

This is used to request to get the overall details about a customer with a given customer number. This will give the customer KYC details as well as information about all the accounts under the given customer account.
supports:   server token  customer token
> Customer number or Reference number or customer token is required.

Customer number of the customer account which wants to get the details.

If customer token is used to send the api request, customer number used to create that token will be considered.
Reference number of the customer account which wants to get the details.

If customer token is used to send the api request, customer number used to create that token will be considered.
Reference number of the customer account which wants to get the details.

The request is used to create a customer and his accounts in the system. This will create customers, their login profile, cash account to manage the cash, portfolio account to manage the holdings, and all the exchange accounts customers allow to trade.
supports:   server token 
>Note - Market data APIs access for new customers will take some time ~ 1-2hrs. >Customer accounts will be created according to the configured default customer profile or subscription package. **Customer profile** ; is similar to a blue print of customer accounts. If this is enabled at the institution level all the customer accounts will be created according to that customer profile. **Subscription package** ; enables to define the set of exchanges to which the exchange/ trading accounts should be created for a customer to trade with currencies. Exchange accounts will be created for all the exchanges defined in the subscription package, the cash accounts will be created according to the respective exchange and configured currency and security account will be created with type equity for each cash account. >Note: Please try again, If you receive error code - 1123.

This endpoint will return stock transactions of the current date(UTC) or day before current date.
supports:   server token  customer token
If time is in the request, if date is current date or null : response will only contain transaction from given time to current time. if date is day before current date : response will only contain transaction from given time to end of the date.
UTC time.
today or yesterday

today or yesterday

his is used to request to deposit some amount from customer cash account in the system by the end customer.
supports:   server token  customer token
TThis facilitates a request from the end customer to deposit a specified amount into their cash account within the system. >Security account number or cash account number is required. Cash account number will be prioritized

This is used to request to withdraw some amount from a customer cash account in the system by the end customer.
supports:   server token  customer token
This function serves as a request to withdraw a specific amount from a customer's cash account within the system, initiated by the end customer. Security account number or cash account number is required. Cash account number will be prioritized

This is used to get the details of the deposit and withdrawal requests initiated by the customers. This also gives the current status of the requests made by customers.
supports:   server token  customer token

>The response will be related to the institution retrieved from auth token.

Use to get the list of supported trading sessions under each exchange in the system.

supports:   server token  customer token
#| type ---------|---------- 0 | Day 1 | Good Till Cancel 2 | At the Opening 3 | Immediate or Cancel 4 | Fill or Kill 5 | Good Till Crossing 6 | Good Till Date 7 | At the Close 8 | Month 9 | Session

supports:   server token  customer token
#| type ---------|---------- 1 | Market 2 | Limit 3 | Stop/Stop Loss/Stop Market 4 | Stop Limit P | Trailing Stop

An endpoint to get assigned exchange list for an institution.
supports:   server token  customer token
> This only shows exchanges assigned to relevant institutions which are created for the relevant Fintech. If you require to add more exchanges, please communicate the requirement to GTN team. >The response will be related to the institution retrieved from auth token.

This endpoint gives the Shariah compliant symbol details for the given exchange.
supports:   server token  customer token
> clientClassification based filtering is currently only available in MENA region. >For non-shariah compliant symbols, clientClassification is not available.
(Required)
This is optional. If not present response will include all the Shariah compliant symbols for the given exchange. If present response will indicate whether it's Shariah compliant or not.

O ; General Symbol, 1 ; Client Compliant Symbol

 This is optional. If not present, response will include both general and client compliant symbol data.
(Required)
This is optional. If not present response will include all the Shariah compliant symbols for the given exchange. If present response will indicate whether it's Shariah compliant or not.

O ; General Symbol, 1 ; Client Compliant Symbol

 This is optional. If not present, response will include both general and client compliant symbol data.
(Required)
This is optional. If not present response will include all the Shariah compliant symbols for the given exchange. If present response will indicate whether it's Shariah compliant or not.

O ; General Symbol, 1 ; Client Compliant Symbol

 This is optional. If not present, response will include both general and client compliant symbol data.

This is optional. If not present response will include all the tradable and non-tradable symbols for the institution. If present response will indicate tradable and non-tradable symbols for the given exchange.

This is optional. If it presents, response indicates commission groups for the given exchange. If not response indicates all the commission groups for the institution.
This is optional. If it presents, response indicates commission groups for the given exchange. If not response indicates all the commission groups for the institution.
This is optional. If it presents, response indicates commission groups for the given exchange. If not response indicates all the commission groups for the institution.

description.content: (Required)

Use to get details of the given institution.
Internal API (intended exclusively for internal development purposes)
supports:   server token  customer token
(Required)

Required categories sent in the format as in example separated by commas.When adding more than one category separated by commas, do not add a space in between. All categories will be returned by default. Currently, only 4 category types are supported. More will be added in the future based on requirements.

 **info** -details about the institution

 **config** -configuration details related to the institution

 **searchConfigs** - all the assigned asset classes of the institution

 **defaults** - default configuration details of the institution(eg: default symbols list)
(Required)

Required categories sent in the format as in example separated by commas.When adding more than one category separated by commas, do not add a space in between. All categories will be returned by default. Currently, only 4 category types are supported. More will be added in the future based on requirements.

 **info** -details about the institution

 **config** -configuration details related to the institution

 **searchConfigs** - all the assigned asset classes of the institution

 **defaults** - default configuration details of the institution(eg: default symbols list)
(Required)

Required categories sent in the format as in example separated by commas.When adding more than one category separated by commas, do not add a space in between. All categories will be returned by default. Currently, only 4 category types are supported. More will be added in the future based on requirements.

 **info** -details about the institution

 **config** -configuration details related to the institution

 **searchConfigs** - all the assigned asset classes of the institution

 **defaults** - default configuration details of the institution(eg: default symbols list)
(Required)

Required categories sent in the format as in example separated by commas.When adding more than one category separated by commas, do not add a space in between. All categories will be returned by default. Currently, only 4 category types are supported. More will be added in the future based on requirements.

 **info** -details about the institution

 **config** -configuration details related to the institution

 **searchConfigs** - all the assigned asset classes of the institution

 **defaults** - default configuration details of the institution(eg: default symbols list)

Use to place an order.
supports:   server token  customer token
import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs'; import 'react-tippy/dist/tippy.css'; import {Tooltip} from 'react-tippy'; import InfoIcon from '/icons/info.svg'; import DoubleArrowIcon from '/icons/double_arrow.svg'; ## Supported Order Types #### Request Body ```js showLineNumbers { "externalOrderId": "ext-ord-001", "accountNumber": "P000128310", "securityType": "CS", "symbol": "AAPL", "exchange": "NSDQ", "quantity": 100, "orderType": "2", "orderSide": 1, "price": 2, "tif": 0, "tradingSession": "REG", "orderValue": 1 } ```
Field Name  
accountNumber required
securityType optional   If you not set the value for securityType system will fallback type to the Equity )} >
symbol required   If a symbol contain backslash ( \ ) character, it needs to be replaced by double backslash ( \ ) when included in the symbols list (Ex. for Futures) )} >
exchange required
quantity optional   quantity or orderValue is required
If quantity > 0, order will place using quantity not orderValue.
For market type sell side equity orders, quantity must be > 0
For limit type sell side equity orders, if quantity is null or 0, quantity will be taken by dividing the given orderValue by given price )} >
orderType required
orderSide required
price required selectively
tif required
Field Name  
expiryDate required selectively (GTD)
tradingSession optional
orderValue optional   quantity or orderValue is required
For limit type sell side equity orders, if quantity is null or 0, quantity will be taken by dividing the given orderValue by given price )} >
externalOrderId optional
stopPrice Optional
trailByValue Optional
trailType Optional
instrumentType optional (Possible values: 0,60,61,86)
> Fractional trading is not supported for option orders; therefore, option orders cannot be placed using order value. #### Request Body ```js showLineNumbers { "externalOrderId": "ext-ord-001", "accountNumber": "P000128310", "securityType": "OPT", "symbol": "AAPL\\23F30\\65.0", "exchange": "OPRA", "quantity": 100, "orderType": "2", "orderSide": 1, "price": 2, "tif": 0 } ```
Field Name  
accountNumber required
securityType OPT
symbol required   If a symbol contain backslash ( \ ) character, it needs to be replaced by double backslash ( \ ) when included in the symbols list (Ex. for Futures) )} >
exchange required
quantity optional
orderType required
orderSide required
Field Name  
price required selectively
tif required
expiryDate required selectively (GTD)
externalOrderId optional
stopPrice optional
instrumentType optional (Possible values: 10)
#### Request Body ```js showLineNumbers { "externalOrderId": "ext-ord-001", "accountNumber": "P000284369", "securityType": "BND", "symbol": "ANF 8 x83x82x82 07/15/25", "exchange": "BOND", "amount": 2000, "orderType": "2", "orderSide": 1, "price": 50, "tif": 0, "expireTime": "2023/11/10" } ```
Field Name  
accountNumber required
securityType BND   If you not set the value for securityType system will fallback type to the Equity )} >
symbol required   If a symbol contain backslash ( \ ) character, it needs to be replaced by double backslash ( \ ) when included in the symbols list (Ex. for Futures) )} >
exchange required
orderType required
orderSide required
Field Name  
price required selectively
tif required
expiryDate required selectively (GTD)
amount required
externalOrderId optional
instrumentType optional (Possible values: 75)
#### Request Body ```js showLineNumbers { "externalOrderId": "ext-ord-003", "accountNumber": "P001133137", "symbol": "AFB007013406", "exchange": "MFSFUNDS", "orderSide": 2, "securityType": "FND", "amount": 5000, "isPartialRedemption": 0, "investmentId": "FO240313-2-000024" } ```
Field Name  
accountNumber required
securityType FND   If you not set the value for securityType system will fallback type to the Equity )} >
symbol required   If a symbol contain backslash ( \ ) character, it needs to be replaced by double backslash ( \ ) when included in the symbols list (Ex. for Futures) )} >
exchange required
orderSide required
Field Name  
externalOrderId optional
amount required for buy or partially redeem orders
isPartialRedemption required for redeem(sell) orders
investmentId required for redeem(sell) orders
instrumentType optional (Possible values: 2)
#### Request Body ```js showLineNumbers { "externalOrderId": "ext-ord-001", "accountNumber": "P000128310", "symbol": "XAU/USD", "exchange": "GTNSPOT", "quantity": 1, "orderType": "2", "orderSide": 1, "price": 2, "tif": 0, "tradingSession": "REG", "orderValue": 100, "securityType": "CS", "instrumentType": "60" } ```
Field Name  
accountNumber required
securityType optional   If you not set the value for securityType system will fallback type to the Equity )} >
symbol required   If a symbol contain backslash ( \ ) character, it needs to be replaced by double backslash ( \ ) when included in the symbols list (Ex. for Futures) )} >
exchange required
quantity optional   quantity or orderValue is required
If quantity > 0, order will place using quantity not orderValue.
For market type sell side equity orders, quantity must be > 0
For limit type sell side equity orders, if quantity is null or 0, quantity will be taken by dividing the given orderValue by given price )} >
orderType required
orderSide required
Field Name  
price required selectively
tif required
expiryDate required selectively (GTD)
tradingSession optional
orderValue optional   quantity or orderValue is required
For limit type sell side equity orders, if quantity is null or 0, quantity will be taken by dividing the given orderValue by given price )} >
externalOrderId optional
instrumentType optional (Possible values: 0,60,61,86)

Use to cancel an order.
supports:   server token  customer token
Order status will change according to following sequence. 1.Send to Cancel 2.Pending Cancel 3.Cancelled or Reject > When canceling OMS-accepted orders, this API does not return a new orderReferenceId; instead, it returns the previous orderReferenceId obtained when placing the order. >orderId or orderReferenceId should be required. Field Name | Equity | Option | Fixed Income | Fund | Spot ---------|----------|---------|---------|---------|--------- orderId| optional | optional | optional | optional | optional orderReferenceId | optional | optional | optional | optional | optional

This is used to get the tentative commission and VAT for a particular buy or sell order before submission. This tentative values and actual values after the trade is completed can be slightly different.
supports:   server token  customer token
>Please use Estimate Order Charges instead. > quantity or orderValue is required. if quantity > 0, order will place using quantity not orderValue. > same equity instrument types will be added for SPOT orders as well. > If the order type is Market (1) or Limit (2), the price field is required to be sent. > to get BOND commission and vat, use amount instead of quantity. Field Name | Equity | Option | Fixed Income | Fund | Spot ---------|----------|---------|---------|---------|--------- accountNumber | required | required | required | required | required symbol | required | required | required | required |required exchange | required | required | required | required | required quantity | optional | optional | N/A | N/A | optional orderType | optional | optional | optional | N/A | optional price | required | required | required | N/A | required tradingSession | optional | N/A | N/A | N/A | optional orderValue | optional | N/A| N/A | N/A | optional securityType | optional | optional | optional | optional | optional instrumentType | optional | optional | optional | optional | optional amount | N/A | N/A | required | required | N/A | asset | security type| instrument type | ---------|----------|---------| equity| CS | 0,60,61,86| option| OPT | 10 | fixed income | BND | 75 | mutual fund | FND | 2 |

This is used to get the details of an individual order. This will give all the details about the order as well as the list of executions that took place on that order.
supports:   server token  customer token
> orderId or orderReferenceId or (externalOrderId and securityType) is required.
available only for equity/option/asset orders
required when externalOrderId is used to get the order details
available only for equity/option/asset orders
required when externalOrderId is used to get the order details
available only for equity/option/asset orders
required when externalOrderId is used to get the order details

This is used to search the order history. This can also be used to get a list of all the orders for a given period that match the given criteria.
supports:   server token  customer token
> Security type is required when there is no security account number. > If a symbol contains a backslash ( \ ) character, it needs to be replaced by %5C. (Ex.BOND\23H18\87.0 is replaced by BOND%5C23H18%5C87.0 ). >If a symbol contains a backtick (`` ` ``) character, it needs to be replaced by %60. (Ex.510`TB is replaced by 510%60TB ). >When this end point is accessed via a server token and if orders should be retrieved only for a customer, customerNumber should be passed mandatorily.
